table-wrap.anchoringText: In addition, also as listed in Table 1, the range of the 40 basis function coefficients used for updating the permeability field.
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Table of calibration parameters

table-wrap.anchoringText: NCYCLES is defined as the total number of WAG cycles within a stipulated period of time. For both the seisitivity and optimization studies, the WAG operational period was fixed for 2 years. Operational bounds for each parameter, as specified by the operator, are provided in Table 2. Additional operational constraints required by the operator include minimum production bottomhole pressure (BHP), maximum injection pressure, maximum liquid production rates and maximum CO2 and water injection rates at surface conditions.
table-wrap.label: Table 2
table-wrap.caption: List of parameters and values used for WAG sensitivity study and optimization

formatted-caption.caption-text: List of parameters and values used for WAG sensitivity study and optimization

tr.td: Hydrocarbon Pore Volumes of CO2 Injected, CO2PVI

table-wrap.anchoringText: A scatter plot of 20,000 sampled parameter combinations evaluated using the proxy model is presented in the objective function space in Fig. 21. Based on the preference of the operator, we select an optimal, intermediate and poor designs that correspond to 90, 50, and 10 percentiles of two objectives as shown in the figure. The design parameters for these three solutions are provided in Tables 3.
table-wrap.label: Table 3
table-wrap.caption: Table of optimal and sub-optimal set of parameters for 2-year optimization period

formatted-caption.caption-text: Table of optimal and sub-optimal set of parameters for 2-year optimization period

tr.td: Hydrocarbon Pore Volumes of CO2 Injected, CO2PVI

table-wrap.anchoringText: The schedules obtained for the three selected solutions were repeated for another two years for a total duration of 4 years for the CO2 WAG operations. The results obtained are shown in Table 4. We also provide the injection and production rate profile comparisons for the three cases in Fig. 22 and a visualization of the CO2 sweep in the three cases in Fig. 23. Clearly, these figures show good agreement with the numerical results. As shown in the figures, better CO2 sweep was achieved in the optimal case compared to other cases.
table-wrap.label: Table 4
table-wrap.caption: Table of optimal and sub-optimal set of parameters for 4-year optimization period

formatted-caption.caption-text: Table of optimal and sub-optimal set of parameters for 4-year optimization period

tr.td: Hydrocarbon Pore Volumes of CO2 Injected, CO2PVI
